Data: MyAnimeList.net      Hide AdsLoginSign Up  AllAnimeMangaCharactersPeopleCompaniesManga StoreNewsFeatured ArticlesForumClubsUsers               View all results for ${ keyword }  Anime  Anime Search Top Anime Seasonal Anime Videos Reviews Recommendations 2022 ChallengeFantasy Anime League  Manga  Manga Search Top Manga Manga Store Reviews Recommendations 2022 Challenge   Community  Interest Stacks Forums Clubs Blogs Users   Industry  News Featured Articles People Characters Companies MAL×Japan   Watch  Episode Videos Anime Trailers  Read  Manga Store   Help  About Support Advertising FAQ Report StaffMAL Supporter     Reviews                Top                             >                 Anime                             >                 Shingeki no Kyojin: The Final ...                             >                 Reviews                             >                 reizamundi's Review                               Apr 13, 2022                    12 of 12 episodes seen                 Overall Rating:         7          Shingeki no Kyojin: The Final Season Part 2  (Anime) add            (All reviews)                         reizamundi (All reviews)   1                people found this review helpful                           more pics      Overall 7   Story 5   Animation 8   Sound 6   Character 5   Enjoyment 9                              Despite the disappointment in the narrative towards the end of the series, I have grown too attached to the characters and story to give this season a poor review.  Nevertheless, I felt that the art and animation looked a lot better than part 1 of the final season and I did enjoy the watching all the action being animated. It was especially delightful to see Annie and the female titan back.  I didn't like the music from this season so much and using old soundtracks seemed a bit out of place. I wished there were new soundtracks to the actions.   Overall, bumping the ratings higher than it really should be just because I am a fan.   Helpful       report

Product Information Each pack will contain cards of all five members from the same band! https://myanimelist.net/reviews.php?id=4.Title: 86 Part 2 - reizamundi's Review - MyAnimeList.net
Data: MyAnimeList.net      Hide AdsLoginSign Up  AllAnimeMangaCharactersPeopleCompaniesManga StoreNewsFeatured ArticlesForumClubsUsers               View all results for ${ keyword }  Anime  Anime Search Top Anime Seasonal Anime Videos Reviews Recommendations 2022 ChallengeFantasy Anime League  Manga  Manga Search Top Manga Manga Store Reviews Recommendations 2022 Challenge   Community  Interest Stacks Forums Clubs Blogs Users   Industry  News Featured Articles People Characters Companies MAL×Japan   Watch  Episode Videos Anime Trailers  Read  Manga Store   Help  About Support Advertising FAQ Report StaffMAL Supporter     Reviews                Top                             >                 Anime                             >                 86 Part 2                             >                 Reviews                             >                 reizamundi's Review                               Apr 13, 2022                    12 of 12 episodes seen                 Overall Rating:         3          86 Part 2  (Anime) add            (All reviews)                         reizamundi (All reviews)   0                people found this review helpful                           more pics      Overall 3   Story 2   Animation 6   Sound 3   Character 1   Enjoyment 3                              A lot of details were left out when comparing this season to the light novel. It was pretty astonishing to me when presented in the way such as this anime, how terrible the entire narrative of 86  is and that I actually spent the time reading the poorly written novels.   The cinematic choice is quite pretentious in this anime. It felt like the creators were trying so hard to cover the bad story with flashy techniques, e.g. changing the screen ratio, inserting the title of each episode at random places in the timeline, etc.  This is truly a series that I do not understand the appeal of as it can be simply described in two words: bad taste.               Helpful       report

It felt like the creators were trying so hard to cover the bad story with flashy techniques, e.g. changing the screen ratio, inserting the title of each episode at random places in the timeline, etc.  This is truly a series that I do not understand the appeal of as it can be simply described in two words: bad taste. https://myanimelist.net/reviews.php?id=4.Title: Kokkoku - IceCoffee's Review - MyAnimeList.net
Data: MyAnimeList.net      Hide AdsLoginSign Up  AllAnimeMangaCharactersPeopleCompaniesManga StoreNewsFeatured ArticlesForumClubsUsers               View all results for ${ keyword }  Anime  Anime Search Top Anime Seasonal Anime Videos Reviews Recommendations 2022 ChallengeFantasy Anime League  Manga  Manga Search Top Manga Manga Store Reviews Recommendations 2022 Challenge   Community  Interest Stacks Forums Clubs Blogs Users   Industry  News Featured Articles People Characters Companies MAL×Japan   Watch  Episode Videos Anime Trailers  Read  Manga Store   Help  About Support Advertising FAQ Report StaffMAL Supporter     Reviews                Top                             >                 Anime                             >                 Kokkoku                             >                 Reviews                             >                 IceCoffee's Review                               Apr 13, 2022                    12 of 12 episodes seen                 Overall Rating:         6          Kokkoku  (Anime) add            (All reviews)                         IceCoffee (All reviews)   0                people found this review helpful                           more pics      Overall 6   Story 0   Animation 0   Sound 0   Character 0   Enjoyment 0                              This review is specifically about the ending and contains spoilers.  The final episode introduced an interesting idea of what happens to a person when completely isolated with nothing of substance or fulfilment is left for them in life (at least from my understanding).  Starting out, Juri is vigilant (shot of her doing stretches and later exercising) and retains most of her mental stability by reminding her self of family. Eventually boredom and frustration kick in (likely from isolation/nothing to do). To break out she resorts to escapism through excessive drinking and consumption of entertainment, which eventually loses its charm.   Next she has a breakdown followed by repeated attempts to suppress the reality of her situation ("no more depresressing thoughts"). Finally she hits a point where she's on the verge of giving up on life and becoming a handler (bascially choosing death).   At this point her situtation really seems hopeless, what exactly would Juri do to actually salavge her situation? I was really hoping to see some insightful take on this.   But unfortunately the show cops out by switching the narritive to the MC meeting the immortal lady who can end the stasis and free her. Effectively abandoning the idea on what someone might do if completely isolated. I suppose one could argue that the solution is to just keep going and hope you have the luck to bump into someone to help you before you give up? At least from what I see there's importance to being in and appreciating the relationships you have close to you and not just letting them pass you by.  To add some basic alternative endings: - Happy ending: she learns to control statis and effectively control time. Which I don't think is too unreasonable. And would signal maybe that life is what you make of what you got? - Sad ending: she dies at the mercy of isolation, signalling that life is meaningless without someone to share it with?  Final comment: The fact that some fairly simple endings were avoided in a matter I found pretty interesting in favour of a cop out was a pretty big let down.               Helpful       report

Eventually boredom and frustration kick in (likely from isolation/nothing to do). To break out she resorts to escapism through excessive drinking and consumption of entertainment, which eventually loses its charm.   Next she has a breakdown followed by repeated attempts to suppress the reality of her situation ("no more depresressing thoughts"). Finally she hits a point where she's on the verge of giving up on life and becoming a handler (bascially choosing death).   At this point her situtation really seems hopeless, what exactly would Juri do to actually salavge her situation? I was really hoping to see some insightful take on this.   But unfortunately the show cops out by switching the narritive to the MC meeting the immortal lady who can end the stasis and free her. Effectively abandoning the idea on what someone might do if completely isolated. I suppose one could argue that the solution is to just keep going and hope you have the luck to bump into someone to help you before you give up? At least from what I see there's importance to being in and appreciating the relationships you have close to you and not just letting them pass you by.  To add some basic alternative endings: - Happy ending: she learns to control statis and effectively control time. Which I don't think is too unreasonable. And would signal maybe that life is what you make of what you got? - Sad ending: she dies at the mercy of isolation, signalling that life is meaningless without someone to share it with?  Final comment: The fact that some fairly simple endings were avoided in a matter I found pretty interesting in favour of a cop out was a pretty big let down.
